div.l: And seid fare wel malyn̄ my swete wight
Þe dai is cōmmyn I mai no lenger abide
But euer͗e mor͗e wher͗e so I go or ride
I am þin owne clerk so haue I hele
Now dere lēmman qduod she go now fare wele
But er ye go oon þing I wil you tell
Whan þou cōmmest homward bi þe myll
Right atte entre of þe dore be hinde
Thou shalt a kake of half abusshell finde
Þat was made of youre own̄ mele
Which I help my fader to stele
And goode lēmman god þe saue and kepe
And with þat worde she bigan to wepe
Aleyn vp rist and þought er that dawe
I wil go crepe in be my felawe
And fonde þe cradell with his honde a none
Bi god ꝙquod he al wrong I haue mysgone
Mi hede is toty of my swynk þe night
Þat maketh me þat I go not a right
I wote wel bi þe cradell I haue mysgo
Her͗e lieth þe myller and his wife also
And forth he goeth in twenty deuel wey
To þe bed þer͗e as þe myller lay
He went to haue crept yn bi his felawe Iohn
And bi þe Miller he crept in a none
And cauȝt him bi þe nek and soft he spake
And seid þou swynes hede awake
For cristes soule and her͗e a noble game
For bi þat lorde þat called is seint Iame
As I haue thries in þis short nyght
Swyued þe Millers dought̉er bolt vp right
Whiles þou hast as a couert ben̄ a gast
Ye false harlot qduod þe myller͗e hast
A fals traitoʳur fals clerk qduod he
Thou shalt be dede be goddꝭes dignite
Who durst be so bolde to disꝑparage
Mi dought̉er þat is cōmmyn̄ of suche lynage
And by þe throte boll he cauȝt Aleyn̄
And he hent him dispitously a yen̄
And on þe nose he smote him with his fiste
Down ran þe blode streme on his breste
And in þe flore with nose and mouth I broke
Thei walowed as pigges dud in a poke
